lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Monkey.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Monkey.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Monkey is a simple yet powerful task management tool that helps you keep track of your to-dos, deadlines, and events. With Monkey, you can effortlessly add, mark, unmark, delete, and list tasks while also searching for specific tasks using keywords. Monkey ensures that your tasks are saved automatically, so you never lose track of what needs to be done.
Simply run the program to start using Monkey. You will be greeted with:
What can I do for you?
Now you can start entering commands to manage your tasks!
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Monkey supports three types of tasks:
A to-do task is a simple task with no deadline or specific time.
To add a to-do, type: `todo TASK_DESCRIPTION`. For example, `todo Buy toothpaste`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
A deadline task must be completed by a specific date.
To add a deadline, type: `deadline TASK_DESCRIPTION /by DATE`. For example, `deadline Finish Math HW /by Mon`
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
An event task occurs over a period of time.
To add an event, type: `event TASK_DESCRIPTION /from START /to END`. For example, `event Project Meeting /from Thu 3pm /to 5pm`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
To see all tasks in your list, use the `list` command.
Here are the tasks in your list:
To remove a task, type: `delete TASK_NUMBER`. For example, `delete 1`.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Once you complete a task, you can mark it as done.
You can mark a task by typing: `mark TASK_NUMBER`. For example, `mark 2`.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
If you accidentally mark a task as done, you can undo it.
To do so, type: `unmark TASK_NUMBER`. For example, `unmark 2`.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
To search for a task by keyword, use the `find` command.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
If an invalid command is entered, Monkey will notify you.
Oh no! I do not understand the command.
If a command is recognized but missing required inputs, Monkey will prompt the user with the correct format.
Oh no! Events must have the format: event <task> /from <start> /to <end>
Monkey automatically saves your tasks to a file. Your task list will be available when you restart the program.
| `todo`      | Adds a to-do task         | `todo Buy toothpaste`                         |
| `deadline`  | Adds a deadline task      | `deadline Finish Math HW /by Mon`             |
| `event`     | Adds an event task        | `event Project Meeting /from Thu 3pm /to 5pm` |
Monkey is your personal task assistant that keeps your to-dos organized and easily manageable. Start using Monkey today and take control of your tasks effortlessly! üêµüéâ
* The Monkey class represents a task manager that allows users to add, delete, list,
* mark, unmark, and find tasks. It interacts with a TaskList for managing tasks.
* Initializes a Monkey instance with a storage system.
* Adds a task to the task list based on the user input.
* @param input User input indicating the task type and description.
* @throws MonkeyException If the input format is invalid.
public void addTask(String input) throws MonkeyException {
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! The description of a " + parts[0] + " cannot be empty.");
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! Deadlines must have the format: deadline <task> /by <date>");
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! Events must have the format: event <task> /from <start> /to <end>");
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! This command is invalid.");
* Deletes a task by its task number.
* @param taskNumber The index of the task to delete.
* Lists all the tasks in the task list.
* @param taskNumber The index of the task to mark.
* @param taskNumber The index of the task to unmark.
* Finds tasks containing the given keyword.
* The main method that runs the Monkey task manager & handles user input.
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user commands and executing
* the corresponding actions in the Monkey task manager.
* Parses the user input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param input The command entered by the user.
* @param monkey The Monkey instance that manages tasks.
public static void parse(String input, Monkey monkey) {
* The Storage class handles reading and writing tasks to a file for storage.
* It allows tasks to be saved and loaded from a specified file.
/** The file path where tasks are stored. */
/** The directory path where the file is located. */
* Creates a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where the tasks are stored.
* Load tasks from the file into an ArrayList<Task>.
* Returns empty list if the file does not exist.
* @return An ArrayList containing the tasks loaded from the file.
return tasks; // No file yet, return empty list
* Saves the given list of tasks to the file.
* Creates a directory if it does not exist.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Parses a line from the storage file and converts it to a Task object.
* @param line The line to be parsed.
* @return A Task object if the line is valid, otherwise null.
* The TaskList class manages a list of tasks, providing functionality to add, delete,
* mark, unmark, list, and find tasks.
* Creates a TaskList with tasks loaded from storage.
* @param storage The storage system handling tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list and saves it to storage.
* Deletes a task from the task list.
* @param taskNumber The index of the task to delete.
* Lists all the tasks in the task list.
* @param taskNumber The index of the task to mark as completed.
* @param taskNumber The index of the task to unmark.
* Finds and prints tasks that contain the given keyword.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* The Ui class handles all user interactions, including printing messages
/** A horizontal line separator for output formatting. */
* Prints the welcome message upon starting application.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints the exit message when application is closed.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints an error message for an invalid command.
System.out.println("Oh no! I do not understand the command.");
* Prints an error message when an invalid task number is provided.
System.out.println("Oh no! The task number is invalid.");
* @param tasks The list of tasks to display.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list: ");
* Prints a message when a new task is added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param totalTasks The total number of tasks updated.
public static void printTaskAdded(Task task, int totalTasks) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + totalTasks + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message when a task is deleted.
* @param task The task that was deleted.
* @param totalTasks The total number of tasks updated.
public static void printTaskDeleted(Task task, int totalTasks) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + totalTasks + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
* Prints a message when a task is unmarked.
* @param task The task that was unmarked.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: ");
* This represents a task with a deadline.
* A Deadline task has a description and a due date ("by").
* Creates a Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for display in the task list.
* The format includes the task type `[D]`, status `[X/ ]`, description, and due date.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Returns a formatted string representation of the deadline task for file storage.
* The format follows: `D | isDone | description | by`.
* @return A string formatted for saving the deadline task to a file.
* This represents an event task that occurs within a specific time period.
* An Event task has a description, a start time ("from"), and an end time ("to").
* Creates an Event task with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task for display in the task list.
* The format includes the task type `[E]`, status `[X/ ]`, description, start time, and end time.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
return "[E]" + "[" + getStatusIcon() + "] " + description + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Returns a formatted string representation of the event task for file storage.
* The format follows: `E | isDone | description | from | to`.
* @return A string formatted for saving the event task to a file.
* The Task class represents a task with a description, completion status, and
/** Indicates whether the task is completed. */
* Creates a Task with the given description and task type.
* By default, the task is not completed.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is completed, otherwise a space " ".
* Marks the task as not completed.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its type,
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Returns a formatted string representation of the task for file storage.
* @return A string representation of the task for saving to a file.
* A To-do task has only a description without a specific deadline or time period.
* Creates a To-do task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Returns a formatted string representation of the to-do task for file storage.
* @return A string formatted for saving the to-do task to a file.
